subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE
DEPOSITORY: of
L . muricatus
,
A . pseudocometa
and
L . ligoniformis
: not stated.

TYPE
LOCALITY AND HABITAT : of
L . muricatus
: Germany , on unstated substrate; of
A . pseudocometa : La Rosiaz (Lausanne)
, Switzerland , in
Polyporus
sp. [Fungi: Polyporaceae ] and Vallée du Flon (Lausanne), Switzerland , in moss; of
L . ligoniformis : Innsbruck
, Tyrol, Austria , on stumps of dead pine [Plantae: Pinaceae ] trees.

NOTES : (a) specimens reported by
Berlese ( 1887 b: 6 )
as
Seius muricatus
were described as
Lasioseius berlesei (Oudemans)
and
Lasioseius aba Baker & Wharton
; (b) specimens reported by
Burkhardt ( 1920 : 54 )
and
Hase ( 1928 : 271 )
as
Seiulus muricatus Koch
were re-identified by Vitzthum, in
Hase ( 1933 : 237 )
, as
Typhlodromus tineivorus Oudemans.
